Column Comment.0: NODE IDENTIFIER: Unique identification number assigned to a specific point (node)
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: SPATIAL PARCEL DOMINION LAND SURVEY ROAD ALLLOWANCES: anennumerated list of the parcels included in the DLS Road allowances. These parcelsmay be referenced when describing the spatial extent of a business object such as aland right, field or pool.
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.6: EAST WEST DISTANCE: Value of the East/West offset from the starting line to thewell node location.
Column Comment.7: EAST WEST DISTANCE OUOM: East/West distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.8: EAST-WEST START LINE: The east-west starting lines for offset distances. Thesedescriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such as Texassurveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FEL (first east line),NEL (northmost east line),...
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LOCATION TYPE: A reference table identifying the type of obj ect being given a legallocation. For example, node, well, ...
Column Comment.11: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.12: NORTH SOUTH DISTANCE: Distance north or south from the start line to the wellnode location.
Column Comment.13: NORTH SOUTH DISTANCE OUOM: North/South distance original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: NORTH-SOUTH START LINE: The north-south starting lines for offset distances.These descriptions are used primarily for non-orthonormal survey blocks such asTexas surveys and California blocks. For example, entries could be FSL (first southline),ESL (eastmost south line), ...
Column Comment.15: ORIENTATION: The orientation of measurements to reference lines. For example,parallel, perpendicular, ...
Column Comment.16: SPATIAL PARCEL CARTER: this table provides an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the carter survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.17: SPATIAL PARCEL CONGRESSIONAL: an ennumerated list of the parcels includedin the congressional survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.18: SPATIAL PARCEL DOMINION LAND SURVEY: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the DLS survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.19: SPATIAL PARCEL FEDERAL PERMIT SYSTEM: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the FPS Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.20: SPATIAL PARCEL LIBYA: an ennumerated list of the parcels included in the Libyansurvey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing the spatial extentof a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.21: SPATIAL PARCEL NE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included in theNE LOCATION Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describingthe spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.22: SPATIAL PARCEL NORTH SEA LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the NORTH SEA LOCATION Survey system. These parcels may bereferenced when describing the spatial extent of a business object such as a landright, field or pool.
Column Comment.23: SPATIAL PARCEL NATIONAL TOPOGRAPHIC SERIES: an ennumerated list of theparcels included in the NTS Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.24: SPATIAL PARCELOFFSHORE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the Offshore Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.25: SPATIAL PARCEL OHIO LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels included inthe Ohio Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing thespatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.26: SPATIAL PARCEL PUBLIC LAND BLOCK LOCATION: an ennumerated list of theparcels included in the Public land block Survey system. These parcels may bereferenced when describing the spatial extent of a business object such as a landright, field or pool.
Column Comment.27: SPATIAL PARCEL TEXAS LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcels includedin the Texas Survey system. These parcels may be referenced when describing thespatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.28: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.29: REFERENCE LOCATION: Description of the starting point for metes and boundsmeasurements. Typically the legal description of the corner. e.g. SE12-80-05-W5M,which represents the SE corner of section 12, township 80, range 5, West of the 5thMeridian in the DLS system. Similar constructs can be developed for the other legalsurvey systems. May also be used to refer to monument or other position used asreference point. Considered an unconstrained reference to MONUMENT.
Column Comment.30: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.31: SURFACE LOCATION: Location description for the surface of the wellbore.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
